intro: "Once Again” is a story about parting. One summer, a boy growing up crosses time and space to meet a certain person. The moment they meet, the boy's summer turns
description:
If you could cross time and space, who would you like to see the most?

In the usual boring summer, when the boy Natsu blows out the candles on his birthday cake, something unexpected happens. He crosses time and space and meets the person he has most wanted to meet in his life, but has never met. In that time-space, not only did Natsu meet “that person,” but “that person” taught him how to take photographs and capture lost time in the frame. Which “that person” made Natsu want to stay here the most? What was the process that Natsu and “that person” followed?

Is “Once Again” a promise to meet again, or does it mean that they will never see each other again? The final meaning can only be known by taking part in this journey.

Game Features
- A birthday is the time each year that Natsu gets to spend with “the one”. It is a time of love and eternal memory.

- The encounter between Natsu and “that person” that transcends time and space. The most moving story of this summer.

- The story is advanced through interactive methods such as screen swiping, controlling the main character, etc.

- Various hand-drawn animations and sketch-like scenes of time and space that make the story more beautiful and moving.

- The game teaches camera skills, such as how to adjust the light and focus.
